data.title: Beats Hooters for Fight Night
data.text: Rating is for UFC and Pay per view fights. In Burbank you have Hooters. That was my first try but for some reason place was empty, doors locked 30 mins before main event with 50 people outside.  I will never go to Buffalo Wild Wings again so that's out of the question.  I remembered Fantasia having a poster so we walked there.  Paid like $7 more than Hooters was asking but worth it.  Found bar High table, reasonable priced cold beer and multiple screens.  Crowd was more mature than Hooters/Barneys/Wild Wings but in a good way, no Fat Frat boys in Kobe or NFL Jerseys, rather Filipino mail man or dialysis nurse types with penguin or polo logo on shirt and pleated Khakis.

data.title: Great place!
data.text:
What a great place to watch a sporting event!!  It beats going to other places in the area where you have to pay in order to sit.  

Saw the UFC fight here and I enjoyed it here.  Sat around the billiards area.  Since it was busy the waiter came often enough as she could so no complaints there.  It was funny though they ran out of glasses so I couldn't get water and had to buy bottled water.

The food was your typical bar food...it was decent.  The service, was good throughout the night (keeping in mind it was a busy day) coming every now and then and the food came in a reasonable time.

data.title: After work drinks
data.text: Our office meets here after work from time to time on Fridays.  Lot's of pool tables and tv screens.  They do serve food and drinks. Service is very good.  Large inside so it's nice for a large group.

data.title: Better for drinks than food.
data.text: I went here a few nights. Lots of pool tables. If you like that then its a good spot. Outside patio area and they do serve food. Cool staff and cute servers.
